Authors:
Peter Warren Fritsch, Camille Nowell, Lila Leatherman, Wei
Gong, Boni C. Cruz, Dylan Orion Burge, Alfonso Delgado Salinas
Title:
Leaf adaptations and species boundaries in North American
Cercis: Implications for the evolution of dry floras
Keywords:
biogeography; cryptic species; leaf adaptations; Fabaceae;
morphometrics; phylogenetics
Abstract:
PREMISE OF THE STUDY: The North American Cercis clade
spans dry to mesic climates and exhibits complex morphological
variation. We tested various proposed species classifications of this
group and whether aspects of leaf morphology, particularly the
“drip-tip” in some regional populations, are adaptive and/or linked with
phylogeny.
